[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Providers] [Metrics provider manipulation] Can MetricsProviderConfig cache_ttl_ms be set to extremely high values, causing stale metrics to be used for validation decisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Providers] [Noise provider downgrade] Can NoiseProviderConfig be configured to disable encryption or use weak cryptographic parameters? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Providers] [System information leakage] Can SystemInformationProviderConfig be exploited to extract sensitive system details from target nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Providers] [Cache poisoning] Can check_delay_secs in CommonProviderConfig be manipulated to cause timing-based cache poisoning attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Runner] [Retry exhaustion] Can SyncRunnerConfig.num_retries be set to u8::MAX (255) causing excessive retry attempts that DoS target nodes or consume excessive resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Runner] [Retry delay timing attack] Can retry_delay_secs be set to zero or very low values to enable timing side-channel attacks against target nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Runner] [Concurrent checker conflicts] When multiple checkers run concurrently via try_join_all(), can race conditions cause inconsistent validation results or resource conflicts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Runner] [Provider collection mutation] Can the ProviderCollection be mutated during concurrent checker execution, causing use-after-free or data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Serialization] [Clone safety] Do all cloned Configuration and BaselineConfiguration instances properly deep-copy sensitive data like public keys and cookies, or can shallow copies leak references? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Serialization] [Debug trait exposure] Can the Debug trait implementation on Configuration expose sensitive data in logs or error messages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Serialization] [Serde skip bypass] In NodeAddress, cookie_store has #[serde(skip)] - can an attacker exploit this to provide their own cookie store during deserialization? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Memory] [Arc/Mutex deadlock] Does the cookie_store Arc<Jar> usage in NodeAddress properly avoid deadlocks when multiple threads access cookies concurrently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Memory] [Client timeout overflow] Can timeout Duration values in get_metrics_client() or get_api_client() overflow, causing connections to hang indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Memory] [Unbounded configuration size] Is there a limit on BaselineConfiguration size (number of checkers, config data) to prevent memory exhaustion attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Errors] [Context information leak] Do anyhow::Context error messages in file loading and validation expose sensitive file paths or configuration details? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Errors] [Error message injection] Can an attacker craft configuration files with malicious content that gets included verbatim in error messages, enabling injection attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Errors] [Panic handling] Are all potential panics (unwrap(), expect()) in the configuration module properly handled to prevent DoS via panic attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [CLI] [Path injection via clap] Can the --path argument in Validate be exploited to bypass clap's PathBuf parsing and inject malicious paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [CLI] [Subcommand injection] If additional Command variants are added in the future, does the match in run_cmd() have a catch-all that could execute unintended code? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [CLI] [Environment variable injection] Can attackers manipulate environment variables that clap reads to override configuration settings? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Crypto] [Public key format validation] Does NodeAddress properly validate that x25519::PublicKey is in canonical form and not a weak or invalid key? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Crypto] [Noise protocol version] In as_noise_network_address(), does append_prod_protos() verify the protocol version is current and doesn't allow downgrade attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Crypto] [Key reuse] Can the same x25519::PublicKey be reused across multiple NodeAddress instances, enabling key correlation attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Network] [TLS verification bypass] Do reqwest clients created by get_metrics_client() and get_api_client() properly verify TLS certificates, or can they be configured to skip verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Network] [Redirect following] Can malicious nodes respond with HTTP redirects that lead the node checker to unintended endpoints? (Medium)
